p: We collected eggs, larvae, and pupae with 350-ml standard dippers (Bioquip Products, USA) from their breeding sites and transported them to the Martin Lüscher Emerging Infectious Disease (ML-EID) Laboratory at the Duduville campus of the International Centre of Insect Physiology and Ecology ( icipe) in Nairobi, Kenya. In the laboratory, we reared them to adults in their field-collected breeding water at 28°C temperature, 80% relative humidity, and 12-hour day and night cycles [ 20, 21].
